coredata.dc:title: The pair polarizabilities of Li+/Li+ and Cl−/Cl−
coredata.dc:creator: Bounds, David G.
Hinchliffe, Alan
coredata.dc:description:
Abstract
Ab initio SCF MO energies and pair polarizabilities are reported for the pairs Li+/Li+ and Cl−/Cl− over the ranges of internuclear separation which are of importance in molten LiCl. The shapes of the β(R) curves resemble those of inert gas diatoms. The Cl−/Cl− interaction is predicted to make a rather small contribution to those properties of molten LiCl which depend on α
(2)(R), and a larger contribution to properties which depend on β(R). The Li+/Li+ interaction contributes almost nothing to the bulk polarizability.
